page.title: 01WOOLHOPE GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This elevated part of the{Wye Valley {Area of Exceptional Natural Beauty}is the NE quadrant of the{Woolhope Dome.} A central crescent shaped valley 90m is bounded on the East by a wooded ridge separated from the steep limestone{Marcle Hill}209m by a smaller vale. Hilly ground to the West includes Broadmoor Common and Woolhope, the only village. Drainage is mainly to the Wye. Farming predominates - cereals, sheep & cattle & some orchard and soft fruit. About 20% is managed woodland. Settlement is scanty & scattered. Two factory farming units raising poultry & pigs are the only industry. Good view of Woolhope from Fishpool Hill GR 0360402342. { }
